data.title: Blue Jackets Fall Short of 1993 Penguins’ Record Streak With Loss to Capitals
data.meta_description: The surprising Blue Jackets were one win away from a record-tying 17th straight victory, but Washington halted the streak with an onslaught of five goals.
data.text:
The Columbus Blue Jackets’ winning streak ended at 16 games with a 5-0 loss to the Capitals in Washington on Thursday night.

Before the game, Capitals forward Andre Burakovsky told reporters that it was “going to be a really fun moment for us” to end Columbus’s streak. And Washington, which finished with the league’s best record last season, wasted little time, taking a 2-0 lead in the first 12 minutes.

Later, Burakovsky even got in on the action, scoring Washington’s fourth goal late in the second period.
